definition: last bus or train/last chance
tip/end/final stage/latter part/inessential detail/powder/dust/opera role of old man
team/class/squad/work shift/ranking/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for groups
surname Ban
surname Che
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
war chariot (archaic)/rook (in Chinese chess)/rook (in chess)

sentences.english: Not catching the last bus , we had to walk home.
sentences.chinese: 没有赶上末班车，我们只好步行回家。

sentences.english: She waited at the bus stop until the last bus came in.
sentences.chinese: 她在公共汽车站一直等到末班车进站。

sentences.english: In the happy end on the bus, I met a wage reform.
sentences.chinese: 在快乐的末班车上，我碰上了工资改革。

sentences.english: What time does the last bus leave?
Stop selling ticket at three minutes before the last train arrives.
sentences.chinese: 末班车进站前三分钟停止售票。

sentences.english: Can you still catch the last bus?
You will miss it if you don't go now.
sentences.chinese: 你现在不走的话，就会错过末班车。

sentences.english: I was forced to take a taxi because I couldn't catch the last bus.
sentences.chinese: 因为我没有赶上末班车，只好坐出租车了。

sentences.english: When he missed the last bus, he was at a loss to know what to do.
sentences.chinese: 当他错过末班车之后，他不知道该怎么办了。

sentences.english: The last bus left half an hour ago.
sentences.chinese: 末班车半小时前就开走了。

sentences.english: It just means the last bust left the first stop, Yongxing Street.
sentences.chinese: 我的意思是说末班车车离开第一个站也就是永兴街。

sentences.english: The last bus has gone,and I'll have to foot it.
sentences.chinese: 末班车已经开走，我只得步行了。

sentences.english: A: Can you still catch the last bus?
This is the last train to Beijing? You got it.
sentences.chinese: 这是去北京的末班车了吗？是。

sentences.english: And I’ve got to catch the last bus.

to ride as a passenger/to travel by (car, plane etc)
shuttle bus ferrying passengers between train stations on two different rail lines
to keep up with/to catch up with/to overtake/to chance upon/in time for
platform (at a railway station)
shuttle bus (or train)/train or bus traveling only part of its normal route
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
